title: Young Creators Are Burning Out and Breaking Down (by Taylor Lorenz, The New York Times)
text: Thanks to the app’s algorithmically generated “For You” page, TikTok delivers fame faster than any other platform; it’s possible to amass millions of followers within a matter of weeks. But as quickly as creators rise, they can fall. “It almost feels like I’m getting a taste of celebrity, but it’s never consistent and as soon as you get it, it’s gone and you’re constantly trying to get it back,” said Lauren Stasyna, 22, a TikTok creator in Toronto. “It feels like I’m trying to capture this prize, but I don’t know what the prize even is.”

cryptic.clue: Musical logic guides the flow, a rhythmic rule you ought to know!

indirect.clue: Think of the secret sauce behind your social media feed’s suggestions.

straight.clue: Relating to a set of rules or calculations used in problem-solving or computation.

cryptic.clue: A grand tea produces it, initially.

indirect.clue: What a power plant does, or what a computer program creates.

cryptic.clue: The postman often renders, giving forth with care.

indirect.clue: What a pizza place does, or what a speaker might do with a speech.

straight.clue: To bring and hand over something to the proper recipient.

cryptic.clue: A huge group, a mess, perhaps, but gathering it does.

indirect.clue: Think of collecting a large quantity of something, like wealth or followers.

straight.clue: To gather together or accumulate a large amount of something.

cryptic.clue: Always the same, never wavering, it’s in the plot, a steady tent.

indirect.clue: What you hope for in a good friend, or in a reliable car.

straight.clue: Acting or done in the same way over time; unchanging in nature, standard, or effect.

cryptic.clue: A steady flow, never pausing, always on and on, you see.

indirect.clue: What the waves do, or how a clock ticks.

straight.clue: Continuously over a period of time; always.

cryptic.clue: Catch a prize, perhaps a pure act.

indirect.clue: What a photographer does, or what a detective tries to do with a suspect.

straight.clue: To take into one's possession or control by force or skill.

cryptic.clue: A valued reward, in a tricky maze.

indirect.clue: What you win in a competition, or something you highly value.

straight.clue: A thing given as a reward to the winner of a competition or race or in recognition of outstanding achievement.

cryptic.clue: A fiery urge, run big and bright.

indirect.clue: What a candle does, or how you might feel after a long day of intense work.

straight.clue: On fire; producing heat or light by combustion.

cryptic.clue: Splintering news, perhaps, at a point in time.

indirect.clue: What glass does when dropped, or what a story does when it's newsworthy.

straight.clue: The action of fracturing or damaging something.
